dataset.title: Growth and survival of Scots pine (Pinus sylvestris) provenances, NW Finland, 1993-2002.

abstract.para: Data consists of heights and survival rate of Scots pine in Finnish Lapland. Seeds are collected from northern Finland. In total 115 000 seedlings were planted in 1982-1984 on 20 experimental plots. Survival rate was detected 2 to 5 times between 1982-1992 and height measurement with seedling condition classification once in 1999. Study was carried out by the Finnish Forest Research Institute (FFRI).

intellectualRights.para: Standard procedures apply. Contact data-package owner before publishing.

section.para: Seedlings were planted and their heights were measured during 15 to 17 years of growth.

description.para: Seedlings were planted on 20 experimental plots in Northern Lapland. Survival of the seedlings were detected variably in different plots. Individual tree heights were measured at 15 plots in 1999 and seedling conditions were also classified.

samplingDescription.para:
Seedlings were planted on experimental plots in 1982-1984. Map of experimental design, plot size and spacing are included in data-package. 20 experimental plots are situated in Kittilä, Enontekiö and Inari at Northern Lapland.
Survival rates were calculated as a percentage for each experimental plot. Average heights were calculated for each experimental plot. Data package and description in Finnish only. Experimental plots are still available for furter measurements by permition.
